wikipedia_page.main:
William Frederick Curtis (29 May 1881 – 23 December 1962) was an English cricketer. Curtis was a right-handed batsman. He was born at Leicester, Leicestershire.
Curtis made his first-class debut for Leicestershire against Sussex in the 1911 County Championship at Aylestone Road, Leicester. He next appeared in first-class cricket for the county in 1920, making four appearances in that seasons County Championship, the last of which came against Somerset. In his five matches, he scored a total of 69 runs at an average of 8.62, with a high score of 38.He died at the city of his birth on 23 December 1962.

response: William Curtis was an English botanist.
William Curtis may also refer to:
*Sir William Curtis, 1st Baronet (1752–1829), English businessman, banker and politician
*Sir William Curtis, 2nd Baronet (1782–1847), of the Curtis baronets
*Sir William Curtis, 3rd Baronet (1804–1870), of the Curtis baronets
